name: removeItem(list, index)
content: In real life you sometimes need to remove items at various positions in a list, and make the list smaller. *removeItem(list, index)* makes the "list" one smaller by removing the item at the specified *index* position (moving other items to the left). The index must be a valid index position in the list or you may get unexpected results.

examples.name: Example: List of favorite foods
Example: Queue Up
examples.description: Use a list to simulate a queue, removing people from the front of the list and adding people to the rear.

palette_params.name: list
palette_params.description: The variable name of the list (array) you want to remove an item from.

palette_params.name: index
palette_params.description: The index position you want to remove the item from.

short_description: Removes the item from the array at the specified index position.
tips: - List(array) manipulation functions include: [appendItem(list, item)](/docs/applab/appendItem), [insertItem(list, index, item)](/docs/applab/insertItem) and [removeItem(list, index)](/docs/applab/removeItem).
